text:
log4j 1.3's PatternLayout is a substantial rework of the log4j 1.2 PatternLayout and adds new features like 
longer names and timestamp qualifiers.  This effort attempts to backport the log4j 1.3 PatternLayout so 
that it can be used with log4j 1.2 as an alternative to the log4j 1.2. PatternLayout.
creator: carnold@apache.org
carnold@apache.org
text:
See discussion on log4j-dev on 2007-04-13.

Sandbox project started at

svn co https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/sandbox/log4j/pattern-formatter

Maven is currently configured to use log4j 1.3 alpha8 and project will build (mvn package) and site will 
generate (mvn site).

The next step would be for someone to start attacking the cosmetic checkstyle and PMD issues.  When 
that is complete, the code can then be copied back into the the log4j 1.3 trunk (I'm trying to branch 
after the cosmetic issues) using "svn cp" and then the next phase (backporting to use log4j 1.2 can 
start).

Anyone feel free to start cleaning up the code.
